    • initalIntegralFormulas

      protected HashMap<String,Double[][]> initalIntegralFormulas()
      指定者:
      initalIntegralFormulas 在类中 IntegralBase

    • transformPoints

      protected <T extends Polygon> Double[][] transformPoints(T triangle, Double[][] integralPoints)
      Transforms the given points from the integral coordinates to the real coordinates of the given triangle.

      The integral coordinates are the coordinates of the points in the integral, and the real coordinates are the coordinates of the points in the triangle.

      The transformation is done with the following formulas:

      x = x3 + li * (x1 - x3) + lj * (x2 - x3) y = y3 + li * (y1 - y3) + lj * (y2 - y3)

      where (x1, y1), (x2, y2), and (x3, y3) are the coordinates of the vertices of this triangle, and (li, lj) are the coordinates of the point in the integral.

      指定者:
      transformPoints 在类中 IntegralBase
      参数:
      triangle - the triangle to transform the points to
      integralPoints - the points to transform
      返回:
      the transformed points

    • integralFormulaToString

      protected String integralFormulaToString(Double[][] pointWithWeights)
      Converts an array of IntegralPointWithWeight objects into a formatted string representation specific to the triangle simplex.

      This method takes an array of IntegralPointWithWeight, retrieves the integral points and their weights, and formats them as a string. Each point's coordinates are followed by its weight, separated by commas, and each point-weight pair is separated by a semicolon. The entire sequence is enclosed in square brackets and ends with a semicolon.

      This string representation is used to describe the integral formula in a human-readable format.

      指定者:
      integralFormulaToString 在类中 IntegralBase
      参数:
      pointWithWeights - the array of IntegralPointWithWeight objects to convert
      points - the array of IntegralPointWithWeight objects to convert
      返回:
      the formatted string representation of the integral points and weights

    • integrate

      public double integrate(Triangle triangle, BiFunction<Double,Double,Double> func, String formulaName)
      Integrates a bi-variable function over a given triangle using a specified integral formula.

      The method retrieves the integral formula by name and uses it to perform numerical integration over the triangle. It throws an exception if the specified formula is not found.

      The supported integral formulas can be found at online documentation.

      参数:
      triangle - the triangle over which the integration is performed
      func - the bi-variable function to integrate
      formulaName - the name of the integral formula to use for integration. The available formulas are: "ORDER1POINT3", "ORDER3POINT7", "ORDER5POINT12", "ORDER7POINT18", "ORDER7POINT27", "ORDER10POINT30", "ORDER11POINT36_v1", "ORDER11POINT36_v2", "ORDER11POINT36_v3", "ORDER11POINT36_v4", "ORDER11POINT36_v5", "ORDER11POINT36_v6", "ORDER11POINT36_v7". Or use the method IntegralBase.getEnableIntegralFormulaName() to get all the available formulas.
      返回:
      the result of the integration
      抛出:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified formula is not found

    • integrate

      public double integrate(Triangle triangle, BiFunction<Double,Double,Double> func, Double[][] pointWithWeights)
      Integrates a bi-variable function over a given triangle using the specified integral points and weights.

      The method retrieves the integral points and weights, transforms them into the real coordinates of the triangle, and then applies the function to each point and multiplies the result by its weight. The results are then summed up.

      The integral points and weights are expected to be in the format of a 2D array of doubles, where each row has 3 elements: the x and y coordinates of the point, and its weight. The array must not be null and must have at least one row. Each row must have exactly 3 elements.

      The method throws an exception if the function or the integral points and weights are null, or if the integral points and weights array is not in the correct format.

      参数:
      triangle - the triangle over which the integration is performed
      func - the bi-variable function to integrate
      pointWithWeights - the integral points and weights to use for integration. The array must have 3 elements in each row.
      返回:
      the result of the integration
      抛出:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the function or the integral points and weights are null, or if the integral points and weights array is not in the correct format

    • applyArrayAndTimesWithWeightsAndSum

      protected double applyArrayAndTimesWithWeightsAndSum(BiFunction<Double,Double,Double> func, Double[][] pointWithWeights)
      Applies the given bi-function to each point in the given array of points, multiplies the result by the weight of the point, and sums up the results.

      The given bi-function is applied to the first two elements of each point in the given array of points, and the result is multiplied by the third element of the point, which is the weight of the point. The results are then summed up.

      This method is used to apply a function to each point in the integral, and calculate the integral.

      参数:
      func - the bi-function to apply
      pointWithWeights - the points and their weights to apply the function to
      返回:
      the sum of the results
